content.question: The graph shows the cost and revenue curves for a profit-maximizing firm. Which of the following is true about the firm?

choices.label: The firm operates in a perfectly competitive market, producing the allocatively efficient quantity and charging <math alttext="P sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>P</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
The firm is a monopolist, producing the allocatively efficient quantity and charging <math alttext="P sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>P</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
The firm is a natural monopoly, producing <math alttext="Q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and earning positive economic profit.
The firm operates in an imperfectly competitive market, producing <math alttext="Q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and earning positive economic profit.

The firm operates in a monopolistically competitive market, producing <math alttext="Q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and earning negative economic profit.

content.answer: The firm operates in an imperfectly competitive market, producing <math alttext="Q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and earning positive economic profit.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
